data.text: cut ♦ slash ♦ cut back ♦ scale back ♦ rationalize ♦ downsize

data.enText: These words all mean to reduce the amount or size of sth, especially of an amount of money or a business.
data.chText: 以上各词均含减少、缩小之义，尤指削减经费、缩减生意。

data.enText: cut
to reduce sth, especially an amount of money that is demanded, spent, earned, etc. or the size of a business
data.chText: 指削减、缩减、裁减（尤指经费、开支、收入或生意规模）：

data.enText: The President has promised to cut taxes significantly.
Buyers will bargain hard to cut the cost of the house they want.
data.chText: 买主会竭力讨价还价以压低他们想买的房子的价格。

data.enText: His salary has been cut by ten per cent.
data.chText: 他的薪金减少了百分之十。

data.enText: Could you cut your essay from 5 000 to 3 000 words?
data.chText: 请把你的文章从5 000字删减至3 000字好吗？

data.enText: slash
[often passive] ( rather informal ) (often used in newspapers) to reduce sth by a large amount
data.chText: （常用于报章）指大幅度削减、大大降低：

data.enText: The workforce has been slashed by half.
cut sth back/cut back on sth
to reduce sth, especially an amount of money or business
data.chText: 指削减、缩减、裁减（尤指经费或生意）：

data.enText: We had to cut back production.
scale sth back
( especially NAmE or business ) to reduce sth, especially an amount of money or business
data.chText: 指削减、缩减、裁减（尤指经费或生意）：

data.enText: The IMF has scaled back its growth forecasts for the next decade.
data.chText: 国际货币基金组织已经调低对未来十年的增长预测。

data.enText: rationalize
( BrE , business ) to make changes to a business or system, in order to make it more efficient, especially by spending less money
data.chText: 指对企业或制度进行合理化改革，使合理化、使有经济效益

data.enText: downsize
( business ) to make a company or organization smaller by reducing the number of jobs in it, in order to reduce costs
data.chText: 指公司或机构精简人员以降低成本。

data.enText: Downsize is often used by people who want to avoid saying more obvious words like ‘dismiss’ or ‘make redundant’ because they sound too negative.
data.chText: 人们通常使用downsize以避免使用dismiss或make redundant等词义明显的词，因为这些词听起来过于负面。

data.enText: scale sth down
to reduce the number, size or extent of sth
data.chText: 指减少（数量）、缩小（规模或范围）：

data.enText: We are scaling down our training programmes next year.
data.chText: 我们将在明年缩小培训计划。

data.enText: to cut sth/slash sth/cut sth back/downsize/scale sth down considerably/drastically
to cut/slash/cut back on/scale back/rationalize spending/production
to cut/slash/cut back on jobs
to cut/slash/downsize the workforce
to cut/slash/rationalize the cost of sth
to cut/slash prices/taxes/the budget

example.ex: Despite current price advantage, UK manufacturers are still having to scale back production.
example.tran: 尽管目前在价格上占据优势，英国生产商还是不得不减少产量。

value.def: To scale back means the same as to scale down .
